events.message: The customer reported a car accident that occurred on April 28th involving a collision with another vehicle at an intersection.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident due to the nature of the reported incident involving the insured vehicle.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the customer's claim and to provide ongoing assistance through the process.
The customer received formal acknowledgment from the insurance company confirming the claim has been logged and is under review.
The claims department requested all necessary documentation including the police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and a repair estimate.
The customer submitted the required documents promptly, including vehicle photos and official accident reports, to support the claim.
The claims investigation team began reviewing submitted evidence and contacted involved parties to verify the details of the collision.
The investigation concluded that the insured was not at fault and the damages reported matched the police and photographic evidence.
A settlement amount was proposed covering the full estimated repair costs along with a rental car reimbursement during the vehicle repair period.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and the responsiveness of the assigned agent throughout the claims process.
Management approved the settlement proposal ensuring the customer will receive full coverage for the accident-related damages promptly.
The settlement payment was processed and issued directly to the repair shop and the customer to cover all authorized costs.
The claim was officially closed following confirmation that repairs were completed and the settlement amount was fully disbursed.
All case files and correspondence related to the auto accident claim were archived for future reference in accordance with policy.
